business.headline: Will India be hit with a 500% tariff? Here's what we knowIndia remains one of the few countries still in talks with the US at a time when the Trump administration is preparing to enforce steep new tariffs on imports from several nations starting August 1.

Tesla drops 'coming soon' teaser on new X account ahead of India launchTesla is set to open its first Indian showroom in Mumbai's Bandra Kurla Complex on July 15. The Tesla India X account shared a "coming soon" post on Friday night.

Elon Musk's Tesla likely to begin first deliveries in India from August: ReportThis move comes at a key moment for Tesla. The carmaker has seen sales dip in other countries and is now turning to India, the world's third-largest car market, to reach new buyers.

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath hits back at 'dark patterns' used by financial appsNithin Kamath says these tricks are designed to push people into taking actions that are not in their best interest, just so companies can make more money.
Sensex ends 690 points lower, Nifty settles below 25,200; TCS falls 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 689.81 points to end at 82,500.47, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 205.40 points to close at 25,149.85.

New banks coming soon? India eyes first permits since 2014, says reportThe government and central bank are said to be considering multiple steps to create more, larger and stronger banks that can support India's ambitious economic growth plans over the coming decades.

Got Rs 5 lakh health insurance? Should you buy a top-up or higher sum insuredWhen you file a claim, your base policy settles the expenses first. If the bill crosses that limit, the top-up steps in. Normally, your base plan pays up to its maximum, and then the top-up kicks in to handle the rest.
Sensex plunges 700 points: Why the stock market fell 1% today? The S&P BSE Sensex fell nearly 700 points to 82,509.59, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by nearly 200 points to 25,162.25 as of 12:21 pm.

ITR-2 and ITR-3 excel utilities released: Who can file and what's new?ITR-2 is meant for individuals or Hindu Undivided Families (HUFs) who are not eligible to file ITR-1 (Sahaj). This form is meant for taxpayers who do not have any income from business or profession and do not earn any income like interest, salary, bonus, commission, etc.

Bitcoin breaks $117,000 mark, reaches all-time highAt the time of writing at 11.00 am, the world's largest cryptocurrency is trading at $117,863.18, climbing by 6.13% over the last 24 hours. Crypto experts believe if the supportive policies continue, digital coins could see even more new money coming in.

Tesla drives into India: Mumbai to get first experience centre on July 15The space will allow visitors to explore Tesla's electric cars and related technologies, though test drives and deliveries may not be offered at this stage.

TCS falls 2% on Q1 results miss. Should you buy as IT stocks struggle?TCS share price: The IT giant has lost 2.74% over the past five days and declined 4.37% in the past month. Over a six-month period, the stock is down 22.63%.

entertainment.headline: Anant-Radhika's 1st anniversary: SRK, Salman Khan to Ranveer Singh, celebs send loveBollywood stars Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan, and Ranveer Singh extended their wishes to Anant Ambani and Radhika Merchant on their first wedding anniversary, celebrating the grand occasion with warmth and affection.

Metro In Dino budget is half of reported Rs 85 crore: Sources'Metro... In Dino' was made on a modest Rs 40 crore budget, half of the reported Rs 85 crore. The film is steadily climbing the box office and gaining appreciation for its storytelling and realistic characters.

Chiranjeevi to Ravi Teja, celebs mourn Telugu actor Kota Srinivasa Rao's deathVeteran Telugu actor and former MLA Kota Srinivasa Rao died on July 13. Following the news of his death, several prominent figures from the Telugu film industry paid heartfelt tributes.

Kota Srinivasa Rao, Telugu film icon and ex-Andhra MLA dies at 83Rao made his debut in 1978 with the Telugu film Pranam Khareedu and went on to star in over 750 feature films across Telugu, Tamil, Hindi, and other Indian languages.

Bigg Boss fame Abdu Rozik detained in Dubai over theft allegation, team denies arrestFormer 'Bigg Boss' contestant Abdu Rozik was detained at Dubai airport but not arrested, as clarified by his management team.

Pakistani actor Humaira Asghar Ali laid to rest in LahoreThe late Pakistani model and actor Humaira Asghar Ali was laid to rest in Pakistan's Lahore on Friday. Her funeral was attended by a small gathering of people.

Love Island USA Season 7 Finale: All about when and where to watch and the finalistsAs 'Love Island USA Season 7' nears its end, four couples remain in the running for the $100,000 prize. The finale promises a dramatic conclusion as viewers await to see which couple will emerge victorious.

Actor Kushal Tandon appeals for privacy after fan intrudes his homeActor Kushal Tandon said his home was trespassed on by a fan while he was away. He expressed concern about privacy, especially since his family lives with him. The actor also urged fans to maintain mutual respect and understanding.

Kareena's car was attacked after Saif Ali Khan's stabbing incident: Ronit RoyActor Ronit Roy shared that actor Kareena Kapoor's car was attacked after her actor-husband Saif Ali Khan's hospital discharge. The actor, who manages a security agency, said this further prompted enhanced security measures.

Chhoti Bachi Ho Kya: Tiger Shroff elated over Superman x Baaghi crossoverActor Tiger Shroff expressed excitement over a reference to his film 'Baaghi' in the new 'Superman' movie. The Hindi dubbed version of the film gave a shout-out to 'Baaghi' and used the dialogue 'Chhoti Bachi Ho Kya?'.

Bella Thorne claims Charlie Puth vilified her after she refused to sleep with himAmerican actor Bella Thorne has accused singer Charlie Puth of spreading false claims about their brief relationship, following a series of social media exchanges. Both have since clarified their positions and moved on, with Thorne engaged and Puth married.

TWICE drops empowering, high-energy music video for This is ForK-pop sensation TWICE has made a powerful comeback with their fourth album 'This is For', celebrating womanhood through bold beats and confident visuals. The group's new music video and world tour mark a mature shift in their style, inspiring fans across the globe with themes of self-love and empowerment.

Shiva Rajkumar's look from Ram Charan's Peddi unveiled on his birthdayThe makers of the Telugu film 'Peddi' have unveiled Kannada star Shiva Rajkumar's character name as GourNaidu on his birthday. The film is set for a global release on March 27, 2026.

Censor Board faces flak for cuts in Superman and F1, fans say grow upThe Censor Board has faced widespread criticism for cutting a romantic scene from the Hollywood film 'Superman', sparking debates on its inconsistent censorship standards compared to Bollywood movies. This controversy highlighted ongoing tensions over cultural sensitivity and film certification practices in India.

Are Ashish Chanchlani and Elli AvrRam dating? Fans think so after latest postAshish Chanchlani and Elli AvRam shared a cryptic Instagram post on Saturday, fuelling dating rumours amongst fans. The caption "Finally," added fuel to the already surfacing rumours.

Mini Mathur says many use what Shefali Jariwala did, stresses doctor's adviceFollowing the death of Shefali Jariwala, Mini Mathur emphasised the urgent need for medical supervision and open dialogue to ensure health and safety in beauty procedures.

Panchayat's Sunita Rajwar says people are abusing her over a scene in Season 4Actor Sunita Rajwar responded to backlash from a scene in Panchayat Season 4 in a recent interview. The scene involves Rajwar's character, Kranti Devi, making objectionable remarks towards a pregnant character.

Our new travel buddy: Patralekhaa wants to go bungee jumping with Rajkummar, babyActor Patralekhaa expressed her desire to visit New Zealand with her husband, actor Rajkummar Rao, and their future baby - and even try bungee jumping together. In a recent interview, she also spoke about taking a break from work to focus on her pregnancy.

Exclusive: Salman Khan pushed me to explore commercial roles, says Chitrangada SinghChitrangda Singh joined Salman Khan's upcoming film, 'Galwan', marking her commercial film debut with him. She told India Today he encouraged her to explore mainstream cinema.

general news.headline: What caused Air India crash? Expert rejects pilot error theory, questions probeMore than a month after the Ahmedabad crash that killed 241 people, aviation expert and ex-IAF Director Sanjeev Kapoor has raised serious doubts over the recently released preliminary report.

Radhika targeted for wearing shorts, talking to boys: Best friend slams fatherHaving known her since 2012, Himanshika claimed that Radhika was often targeted for wearing shorts, talking to boys, and living life on her own terms. In a video released by Himanshika, she revealed that Radhika's movements were tightly controlled, with fixed times for going out and returning home.

Can Jannik Sinner crack the Carlos Alcaraz code in grand finale?Wimbledon: Five-time Grand Slam champion Carlos Alcaraz may have had the upper hand over Jannik Sinner, but the World No.1 Italian will be aiming to flip the script when they meet in Sunday's grand finale.

President nominates ex-diplomat, public prosecutor, 2 others to Rajya SabhaPresident Droupadi Murmu has nominated Ujjwal Nikam, Harsh Vardhan Shringla, Meenakshi Jain and C Sadanandan Master to the Rajya Sabha to fill vacancies left by retiring members.

Absolute cinema: Gill tears into Zak Crawley for late evening drama at Lord'sIndia vs England: India captain Shubman Gill confronted England opener Zak Crawley over time-wasting at Lord's. The incident sparked heated exchanges late on Day 3 of the Test match.

Drunk Audi driver jumps curb, runs over 5 sleeping on Delhi footpath; arrestedA drunk driver in Delhi allegedly ran over five sleeping pavement dwellers, including an 8-year-old girl, injuring them. The 40-year-old driver was arrested, and a case has been registered.

Kannada actor Shruti stabbed by husband, her head banged against wallKannada actor Shruthi was attacked by her estranged husband in Bengaluru allegedly over financial and domestic disputes. Preliminary investigations suggest the motive behind the attack was related to domestic and financial issues.

Bigg Boss fame Abdu Rozik detained in Dubai over theft allegation, team denies arrestFormer 'Bigg Boss' contestant Abdu Rozik was detained at Dubai airport but not arrested, as clarified by his management team.

Underrated? KL Rahul showing he is the new rock India can trust at the topF1 level mental training, calmness on the field and a return to the top. KL Rahul has become the new rock that India can trust as an opener in the Test arena.

Iga Swiatek blasts Polish media after Wimbledon triumph: Let me do my jobIga Swiatek, hit back at the Polish media for their criticisms during her worst period in her career after her historic win at the Wimbledon 2025 final with a flawless performance where she did not concede a single game point.

Kota Srinivasa Rao, Telugu film icon and ex-Andhra MLA dies at 83Rao made his debut in 1978 with the Telugu film Pranam Khareedu and went on to star in over 750 feature films across Telugu, Tamil, Hindi, and other Indian languages.

Odisha student sets herself on fire over harassment by teacher, accused arrestedAccording to fellow students, the woman had been mentally distressed for weeks, allegedly due to persistent harassment by her teacher in Odisha's Balasore.

2025 Bajaj Pulsar NS400Z review, first ride: Most fun motorcycle under Rs 2 lakh?We first rode Bajaj's value-for-money performance streetfighter in May 2024, and now there's an update. Is the 2025 NS400Z still maximum bang for your buck?

Russian woman, daughters found living in Karnataka cave, rescued by copsA Russian woman and her two daughters were discovered living in a cave in a remote and landslide-prone area of the forest by Gokarna police in Karnataka during a routine patrol.

Martyrs' Day tensions in Srinagar as graveyard sealed, leaders under house arrestAuthorities in Srinagar imposed a partial lockdown to prevent gatherings at the Martyrs' Graveyard to commemorate Kashmir Martyrs' Day. The move sparked criticism from political leaders who accused the administration of acting undemocratically.

Forced to eat beef, raped: Lucknow minor accuses husband, family of 'Love Jihad'A minor girl from Lucknow has accused her husband and his family of severe abuse, including rape, physical assault, and forced religious conversion. She has urged authorities to take strict action after enduring years of harassment and threats.

Sinner vs Alcaraz: All you need to know about Wimbledon finalWimbledon 2025: Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner will lock horns on Centre Court in the summit clash of the men's singles on Sunday, July 12 at the All England Club.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Gadkari gets candid on why Delhi chokes, retirement plans and favourite toll memeIn an interview with India Today, Nitin Gadkari talks candidly about his work, personal journey, retirement plans, why Delhi chokes in pollution and if he enjoys memes made on toll fees. From using urine as fertiliser to being trolled over tolls, Gadkari holds nothing back in the first episode of UnPolitics.

Neeraj Chopra-Arshad Nadeem face off set for 1st time after Olympics 2024Neeraj Chopra and Arshad Nadeem are all set to renew their rivalry on the field as the India and Pakistan stars will face off at the Silselia Diamond League in Poland, which will take place on August 16.

Air India crash: The many scenarios that fuel cut-off throws upThe AAIB's July 11, 2025, report on the June 12 Air India Boeing 787-8 crash in Ahmedabad, killing 260, cites fuel control switches moving to 'Cutoff' post-takeoff. Pilot confusion, mechanical issues, or sabotage are under investigation, with a final report due by June 2026.

The Great Khali condemns Haryana tennis player's killing: Matter of mentalityDeepak Yadav allegedly shot his daughter Radhika multiple times while she was cooking in their Gurugram home due to disputes over her tennis academy and social-media presence.

Lord's Test: Rahul, Jadeja drag India to parity before dramatic end to Day 3The third Test between India and England continues to hang in the balance as England finished Day 3 on 2/0 after India got all out for 387 in the first innings. KL Rahul scored a brilliant century while Rishabh Pant (74) and Ravindra Jadeja (72) also made valuable contributions.

Deepika Padukone rocks oversized blue shirt at Mumbai airport. WatchDeepika Padukone was seen at the Mumbai airport on the morning of July 13. The actor kept it effortlessly stylish in an oversized blue shirt paired with comfy denims.

KL Rahul explains Pant's Lord's run-out: Tried getting me back on strikeKL Rahul opened up about the untimely run-out of Rishabh Pant at Lord's, calling it a momentum-shifting moment and revealing that Pant was simply trying to put him back on strike before lunch.

Tim Southee takes cheeky massage dig at Gill amid Crawley's delay dramaEngland bowling consultant Tim Southee took a cheeky jab at Shubman Gill, reminding him of his own mid-game massage after the Indian skipper criticised Zak Crawley's time-wasting at the end of Day 3.

KL Rahul gives India's point of view on last over drama: We wanted to bowl twoKL Rahul said that the Indian team were eager to get two overs in before the close of play on Day 3, which led to the spat between the side and opener Zak Crawley. The England opener pulled off some theatrics to ensure India bowled just one over in the end.

England win Birmingham T20I thriller, but India seal series 3-2India may have lost the final T20I in dramatic fashion, but a gutsy series performance — led by Shafali Verma's explosive return — saw them clinch a rare and memorable 3-2 triumph in England.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
